citations.narrative:
A method of identification for puppies less than 16 weeks old is not currently being used. The last cage cards there was
record of was in 2021. Proper identification of dogs is important for disease trace back, or in cases of theft or loss. Class
"A" dealers shall identify all live dogs on the premises. Correct by ensuring proper identification is used, documented, and
maintained for all dogs at the facility. Correct from this day forward.

There is no record of adult dogs having been given the distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies vaccines since 2021.
Distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies are viruses that can cause infected dogs stress, discomfort, pain, or even death. The
current Program of Vet Care prescribes the distemper/parvovirus vaccine yearly and the Rabies vaccine every 1-3 years
(depending on age and vaccine status of the dog) in adult dogs. Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases such
as distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies must be given in accordance with the Program of Vet Care. Correct by following the
instructions in the Program of Vet Care and vaccinate dogs as directed. Correct by: April 18, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(b)(3) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
A method of identification for puppies less than 16 weeks old is not currently being used. The last cage cards there was 
record of was in 2021. Proper identification of dogs is important for disease trace back, or in cases of theft or loss. Class 
"A" dealers shall identify all live dogs on the premises. Correct by ensuring proper identification is used, documented, and 
maintained for all dogs at the facility. Correct from this day forward. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There is no record of adult dogs having been given the distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies vaccines since 2021. 
Distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies are viruses that can cause infected dogs stress, discomfort, pain, or even death. The 
current Program of Vet Care prescribes the distemper/parvovirus vaccine yearly and the Rabies vaccine every 1-3 years 
(depending on age and vaccine status of the dog) in adult dogs. Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases such 
as distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies must be given in accordance with the Program of Vet Care. Correct by following the 
instructions in the Program of Vet Care and vaccinate dogs as directed. Correct by: April 18, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

n
